at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common.communication

Class ClientEndpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common.communication.ClientEndpoint

  • public class ClientEndpoint
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the connection endpoint at a JVM containing GBots with its DataPoint instances. It is implemented as singleton, because there is only one TCP/IP connection to the daemon per JVM necessary.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  ClientEndpoint.Receiver
      This inner class is a thread listening for messages from the daemon.
      private class  ClientEndpoint.ValueChangeDistributor
      This inner class is a thread distributing value changes.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection state of the connection to the daemon.
        Returns:
        true, if there is a TCP/IP connection established

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Establishes the connection to the daemon. Is the connection is established, any call to this method is ignored.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this operation fails

      • disconnectImmediately

        private void disconnectImmediately()
        Closes the connection to the daemon without sending a disconnect message. Is the connection is not established, any call to this method is ignored.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection to the daemon. Is the connection is not established, any call to this method is ignored.

      • waitForAnAnswer

        private Answer waitForAnAnswer()
        Waits for an answer of the buffer daemon.
        Returns:
        the answer or null, if the buffer daemon has sent no answer

      • handleProtocolViolation

        private void handleProtocolViolation()
        A protocol violation has occurred. The connection will be closed.

      • handleDumblyDaemon

        private void handleDumblyDaemon()
        The daemon doesn't answer.

      • handleCommunicationError

        private void handleCommunicationError(java.lang.Exception io)
        There is a communication error occurred.
        Parameters:
        io - the causing exception

      • addValueChangeObserver

        public void addValueChangeObserver(ValueChangeObserver observer)

        Adds a new value change observer to the set of well known observers. If the observer argument is null or the observer argument is currently registered in this object, the method call will have no effect. Note that the registered observers are a set. Multiple registration will not cause multiple notifications about state or value changes.

        Parameters:
        observer - the observer

      • removeValueChangeObserver

        public void removeValueChangeObserver(ValueChangeObserver observer)

        Removes a value change observer from the set of well known observers. If the observer argument is null or the observer argument is not registered in this object, the method call will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        observer - the observer

      • getObservers

        private java.util.Collection<ValueChangeObserver> getObservers()
        Gets all currently registered observers.
        Returns:
        the observers

      • fireCommunicationLost

        private void fireCommunicationLost()
        Notifies any listening ValueChangeObserver about a lost connection.

      • fireValueChanged

        private void fireValueChanged(SimpleData value)
        Notifies any listening ValueChangeObserver about a value change.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • shutdown

        public boolean shutdown()
        This method sends a shutdown message.
        Returns:
        true, if the shutdown message was sent.

      • queryBuffersByName

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> queryBuffersByName(java.lang.String name)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        name - a regular expression specifying the buffer name, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of the names of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryBuffersByMetainfo

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> queryBuffersByMetainfo(java.lang.String topic,
                                                              java.lang.String feature)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        topic - a regular expression specifying the buffer topics, which should be scanned for the wanted features. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole topic name.
        feature - a regular expression specifying the buffer features, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of the names of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryMetainfo

        public BufferDescription queryMetainfo(java.lang.String name)
        This method returns the meta information of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of a buffer
        Returns:
        the buffer meta information, which is null if the buffer doesn't exists or the connection to the daemon is broken

      • getBufferConfiguration

        public BufferConfiguration getBufferConfiguration(java.lang.String bufferName)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get the current configuration data of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the current buffer configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - there is no buffer with the given buffer name

      • setBufferConfiguration

        public boolean setBufferConfiguration(java.lang.String bufferName,
                                      BufferConfiguration configuration,
                                      boolean createAllowed)
        Changes the current configuration of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        configuration - the new buffer configuration
        createAllowed - is the creation of a new buffer allowed
        Returns:
        true, if the configuration was successfully changed in the daemon

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • set

        public SimpleData set(java.lang.String bufferName,
                      java.lang.Number value)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the value to an actor assigned to this data point.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the actor buffer
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        the current actor value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the buffer isn't an actor or the actor isn't in the state BufferState.READY.
